questionsList.questionNameText:
WeiQi or Go is an interesting board game which originated in China more than 4,000 years 1____.The game is played today by millions of people, 2____ thousands in the United States. Its popularity in the United States continues to grow. It is said 3____the rules of WeiQi can be learned in minutes. In fact, it can 4___ a lifetime to master the game. The rules could not be simpler. Two players alternate in 5____black and white stone on a large ruled board, with the aim of surrounding territory. Stones never move and are only removed from the board 6____they are completely surrounded.

WeiQi can teach concentration, balance and discipline, it can also help develop the habit of thinking more 7____ . Each person's style of play reflects his or her personality and can serve as a 8____for self- reflection. Weiqi combines beauty with challenge.The patterns 9____by the black and white stones are visually striking.

The game appeals to many kinds of minds--to musicians and artists, and to mathematicians and computer programmers. Children learn the game easily and can reach high 10____of mastery.
questionsList.label: 2023年山东专升本英语真题
questionsList.analysisText: 解析：根据句意，围棋起源于4000多年前，故选E“ago”。

questionsList.analysisText: 【解析】根据句意，数百万人都在玩围棋这个游戏，包括美国的数千人，此处考查非谓语动词用法，故选I选项“including”。

questionsList.analysisText: 【解析】该题考查 “It is said that……”句型，其中it是形式主语，that引导主语从句，故选F选项“that”。

questionsList.analysisText: 【解析】空格前为情态动词“can”，其后要求使用动词原形，又因“lifetime”属于时间，因此选择动词C选项“take”，表示花一生的时间。

questionsList.analysisText: 【解析】由前面的alternate in判断出空格处应该填名词或者动名词，再根据后面的黑白色的棋子，判断出应该是棋手们轮流下棋子的意思，故选H选项“placing”。

questionsList.analysisText: 【解析】根据空格前后句都是完整句子，判断出空格处缺少连词。空格后面的句子不缺成分，因此选择只起连接作用的连接词，故选A选项“if”。

questionsList.analysisText: 【解析】根据空格前的“thinking more”，确定此处考查副词修饰动词think，故选择L选项 “strategically”。

questionsList.analysisText: 【解析】根据句子结构，空格前high为形容词，空格处应为名词做reach的宾语，又因其后“mastery”，故选J选项“levels”，意为“掌握的程度”。

questionsList.questionNameText:
Passage One

Temperatures are warming and daylight lasts longer. People who like to garden may be ready to get their hands dirty and start clearing the ground for new plantings. But garden experts warn--not too fast.

Jessica Damiano is one such expert. She says that removing plant matter too early can disturb important insects not ready for the cool early spring temperatures. In early spring, those insects are still sleeping. Removing the plant matter before the insects begin their life cycles would mean removing them from the garden. Fewer insects mean less food for birds and fewer flowers and vegetables for the gardener.

Damiano says experts do not all agree on the best time to start cleaning the ground and garden area in spring. But they usually agree to wait until the temperatures are regularly above 10°C. That is when sleeping insects “wake up”. Some experts define “regularly”as at least five days in a row. Damiano says she usually waits seven nights. However, even then, she prefers to keep the plant matter on the ground for another week or so before removing it from the garden. This gives any insects that are still “sleeping” enough time to wake up.

Early cleaning of a garden is often followed by early covering the soil with mulch (覆盖料). Applying mulch makes the garden look neat and clean. But Damiano reminds us that soil and plants are not just for show. They are part of a living ecosystem (生态系统).

Mulch is an important part of a healthy garden. It keeps soil wet, limits the growth of grass, and helps keep soil temperatures even. But timing is important. Mulching before the soil has warmed enough will keep in the cold and slow the reawakening of the plants. This can also limit their growth. And if the soil is wet, early mulching can lead to some diseases. Before applying mulch, wait until it is safe to plant warm-season vegetables in your area.
questionsList.questionTitleText: What does the underlined phrase “to get their hands dirty” in Paragraph 1 mean?
questionsList.label: 2023年山东专升本英语真题
questionsList.analysisText: 细节题。定位到第一段第二句：People who like to garden may be ready to get their hands dirty and start clearing the ground for new plantings. 喜欢园艺的人可能已经准备好弄脏自己的手，开始清理地面，种植新的植物。根据and后面句子的内容得知，是开始一些种植工作。故选C。

questionsList.questionTitleText: What will happen if the plant matter is removed too early?
questionsList.label: 2023年山东专升本英语真题
questionsList.firstOptionText: More flowers will grow in the garden.
questionsList.secondOptionText: Some important insects will be taken away.
questionsList.thirdOptionText: More sleeping insects will be eaten by birds.
questionsList.fourthOptionText: The gardener will harvest more vegetables in fall.
questionsList.analysisText: 细节题。定位到第二段第二句，同义替换，remove的同义词即take away，这里说She says that removing plant matter too early can disturb important insects not ready for the cool early spring temperatures 译文：“她说，过早移除植物可能会干扰那些还没有为早春凉爽气温做好准备的重要昆虫”，故选B。

questionsList.questionTitleText: According to Damiano, when can a gardener start clearing the ground for new plantings?
questionsList.label: 2023年山东专升本英语真题
questionsList.secondOptionText: After the sleeping insects wake up.
questionsList.fourthOptionText: Before the insects begin their life cycles.
questionsList.analysisText: 细节题。定位到第三段第三句：But they usually agree to wait until the temperatures are regularly above 10℃. That is when sleeping insects wake up. 译文：“但他们通常会同意等到温度稳定在10℃以上。这就是熟睡的昆虫‘醒来’的时间”。故选B。

questionsList.analysisText: 细节题。Mulch is an important part of a healthy garden. It keeps soil wet, limits the growth of grass, and helps keep soil temperatures even. 译文：“护根物是健康花园的重要组成部分。它保持土壤湿润，限制草的生长，并有助于保持土壤温度均匀”。C选项中的restrict同义替换文中的limit。故选C。

Temperatures are warming and daylight lasts longer. People who like to garden may be ready to get their hands dirty and start clearing the ground for new plantings. But garden experts warn--not too fast.

questionsList.questionTitleText: This passage is probably selected from a _____.
questionsList.label: 2023年山东专升本英语真题
questionsList.analysisText: 判断文章类型题目。这篇文章反复出现单词garden，plants, flowers, 由此判断主要讲园艺业相关知识的，所以D选项与园艺有关的书籍最合适。

questionsList.questionNameText:
Passage Two

The man who made the first call from a wireless phone is now 94 years old. The year was 1973. Martin Cooper operated a large, heavy new communication device on a street in New York. The device was not physically connected to phone lines. But, Cooper was able to make use of it--he called a technology business competitor.

Fifty years later, the inventor says he hopes wireless phones can make life better but he also expresses some worries. “My most negative opinion is that we don't have any privacy anymore because everything about us is now recorded someplace,” Cooper said. And, he says he is concerned about how easily young people can link to harmful online materials on their mobile phones. Cooper spoke with the Associated Press from Barcelona, where he attended the Mobile World Congress (MWC), the biggest telecom industry trade show. Cooper received an award there for his lifetime of work.

He believes the technology's best days may still be ahead in areas such as education and health care. “Between the cellphone and medical technology and the internet, we are going to cure disease,” he said at the MWC.

Cooper was working for Motorola when he used the Dyna-Tac phone to make a call in April 1973. Things have changed greatly since then. But, he said, “We had no way of knowing this was the historic moment.”Cooper says there are still ways for mobile phones to change. The first one he used weighed over 1 kilogram. Today, they are small. But he thinks one day they will be more like a part of our body than something we hold.

He says perhaps the human body can even power the phones. “The human body is the charging station, right,” he asked. The body makes energy from food, he argues, so it could possibly also power a phone. Instead of holding the phone in the hand, for example, the device could be placed under the skin.

Cooper says he also hopes there can be more protection for internet users concerned about privacy and for children. Speaking about privacy concerns, he said, “It's going to get resolved, but not easily.” He also says there should be a special internet for children so they do not run into materials made for adults.
questionsList.label: 2023年山东专升本英语真题
questionsList.firstOptionText: made the first wireless phone call in 1973
questionsList.secondOptionText: invented a device physically linked to phone lines
questionsList.thirdOptionText: operated a new communication device 94 years ago
questionsList.fourthOptionText: used a wireless phone invented by his business competitor
questionsList.analysisText: 细节题。由题干中关键词“Paragraph 1”，定位到文章第一段。正解A：定位到文章第一句与第三句The man who .....The year was 1973. 由此可推断：在1973首次使用无线电话(手机)打电话。误解B：原文中：The device was not physically connected to phone lines. 该设备实际上没有连接到电话线上。B选项与原文相反：该设备连接到电话线上。误解C：定位到文章第二句和第三句：The year was 1973. Martin Cooper operated a large, heavy, new communication device on a street in New York. 译文：那一年是1973年。马丁·库珀在纽约的一条街道上操作着一种大型、重型的新型通讯设备。但并未提到是94年前做的事。误解D：第一段未指出电话的发明者。

questionsList.questionNameText:
Passage Two

The man who made the first call from a wireless phone is now 94 years old. The year was 1973. Martin Cooper operated a large, heavy new communication device on a street in New York. The device was not physically connected to phone lines. But, Cooper was able to make use of it--he called a technology business competitor.

Fifty years later, the inventor says he hopes wireless phones can make life better but he also expresses some worries. “My most negative opinion is that we don't have any privacy anymore because everything about us is now recorded someplace,” Cooper said. And, he says he is concerned about how easily young people can link to harmful online materials on their mobile phones. Cooper spoke with the Associated Press from Barcelona, where he attended the Mobile World Congress (MWC), the biggest telecom industry trade show. Cooper received an award there for his lifetime of work.

He believes the technology's best days may still be ahead in areas such as education and health care. “Between the cellphone and medical technology and the internet, we are going to cure disease,” he said at the MWC.

Cooper was working for Motorola when he used the Dyna-Tac phone to make a call in April 1973. Things have changed greatly since then. But, he said, “We had no way of knowing this was the historic moment.”Cooper says there are still ways for mobile phones to change. The first one he used weighed over 1 kilogram. Today, they are small. But he thinks one day they will be more like a part of our body than something we hold.

He says perhaps the human body can even power the phones. “The human body is the charging station, right,” he asked. The body makes energy from food, he argues, so it could possibly also power a phone. Instead of holding the phone in the hand, for example, the device could be placed under the skin.

Cooper says he also hopes there can be more protection for internet users concerned about privacy and for children. Speaking about privacy concerns, he said, “It's going to get resolved, but not easily.” He also says there should be a special internet for children so they do not run into materials made for adults.
questionsList.questionTitleText: According to Paragraph 2, Cooper thinks that mobile phones can easily_____.
questionsList.label: 2023年山东专升本英语真题
questionsList.secondOptionText: protect the privacy of young people
questionsList.thirdOptionText: expose children to harmful online materials
questionsList.fourthOptionText: do something harmful to medical technology
questionsList.analysisText: 细节题。由题干中关键词“Paragraph 2”，定位到文章第二段。正解C：定位到第三句: And, he says ... harmful online materials on their mobile phones. 他还说，他担心年轻人很容易通过手机连接到有害的在线内容。C选项译为：儿童会暴露于有害的在线内容。误解A：未提及，无出处。误解B：定位到原文第二句My most negative opinion is that we don’t have any privacy anymore. 译文：我最消极的看法是，我们已经没有任何隐私了。可知B选项：保护年轻人的隐私，与原文相悖。误解D：未提及。

questionsList.questionNameText:
Passage Two

The man who made the first call from a wireless phone is now 94 years old. The year was 1973. Martin Cooper operated a large, heavy new communication device on a street in New York. The device was not physically connected to phone lines. But, Cooper was able to make use of it--he called a technology business competitor.

Fifty years later, the inventor says he hopes wireless phones can make life better but he also expresses some worries. “My most negative opinion is that we don't have any privacy anymore because everything about us is now recorded someplace,” Cooper said. And, he says he is concerned about how easily young people can link to harmful online materials on their mobile phones. Cooper spoke with the Associated Press from Barcelona, where he attended the Mobile World Congress (MWC), the biggest telecom industry trade show. Cooper received an award there for his lifetime of work.

He believes the technology's best days may still be ahead in areas such as education and health care. “Between the cellphone and medical technology and the internet, we are going to cure disease,” he said at the MWC.

Cooper was working for Motorola when he used the Dyna-Tac phone to make a call in April 1973. Things have changed greatly since then. But, he said, “We had no way of knowing this was the historic moment.”Cooper says there are still ways for mobile phones to change. The first one he used weighed over 1 kilogram. Today, they are small. But he thinks one day they will be more like a part of our body than something we hold.

He says perhaps the human body can even power the phones. “The human body is the charging station, right,” he asked. The body makes energy from food, he argues, so it could possibly also power a phone. Instead of holding the phone in the hand, for example, the device could be placed under the skin.

Cooper says he also hopes there can be more protection for internet users concerned about privacy and for children. Speaking about privacy concerns, he said, “It's going to get resolved, but not easily.” He also says there should be a special internet for children so they do not run into materials made for adults.
questionsList.questionTitleText: What does the underlined word “this” in Paragraph 4 refer to?
questionsList.label: 2023年山东专升本英语真题
questionsList.thirdOptionText: Cooper's call via the Dyna-Tac phone.
questionsList.fourthOptionText: The award for Cooper's lifetime work.
questionsList.analysisText: 上下文指代关系题。由原文中的“this”所在句翻译：我们无法得知这是一个历史性时刻，this为代词词性，代指“历史性时刻”，代指内容需定位到上文前两句：Cooper was...when he used the Dyna-Tac phone. Things ... since then.1973年4月，库珀在摩托罗拉工作时，他使用 Dyna-Tac手机打电话。从那以后，情况发生了很大的变化。所以指的是Cooper通过 Dyna-Tac打电话。

questionsList.questionNameText:
Passage Two

The man who made the first call from a wireless phone is now 94 years old. The year was 1973. Martin Cooper operated a large, heavy new communication device on a street in New York. The device was not physically connected to phone lines. But, Cooper was able to make use of it--he called a technology business competitor.

Fifty years later, the inventor says he hopes wireless phones can make life better but he also expresses some worries. “My most negative opinion is that we don't have any privacy anymore because everything about us is now recorded someplace,” Cooper said. And, he says he is concerned about how easily young people can link to harmful online materials on their mobile phones. Cooper spoke with the Associated Press from Barcelona, where he attended the Mobile World Congress (MWC), the biggest telecom industry trade show. Cooper received an award there for his lifetime of work.

He believes the technology's best days may still be ahead in areas such as education and health care. “Between the cellphone and medical technology and the internet, we are going to cure disease,” he said at the MWC.

Cooper was working for Motorola when he used the Dyna-Tac phone to make a call in April 1973. Things have changed greatly since then. But, he said, “We had no way of knowing this was the historic moment.”Cooper says there are still ways for mobile phones to change. The first one he used weighed over 1 kilogram. Today, they are small. But he thinks one day they will be more like a part of our body than something we hold.

He says perhaps the human body can even power the phones. “The human body is the charging station, right,” he asked. The body makes energy from food, he argues, so it could possibly also power a phone. Instead of holding the phone in the hand, for example, the device could be placed under the skin.

Cooper says he also hopes there can be more protection for internet users concerned about privacy and for children. Speaking about privacy concerns, he said, “It's going to get resolved, but not easily.” He also says there should be a special internet for children so they do not run into materials made for adults.
questionsList.questionTitleText: Cooper thinks that the mobile phone in the future may_____.
questionsList.label: 2023年山东专升本英语真题
questionsList.fourthOptionText: be powered by the human body
questionsList.analysisText: 细节题。由题干中关键词“mobile phone in the future”定位到原文的第四段。可从原文直接寻找答案出处。正解D：He said perhaps the human body can even power the phones.译文：他说人体可为手机供电。由此D选项正确。误解A：定位到原文：The first one he used weighed over l kilogram. 译文：库珀曾用过的第一部手机重超过1千克。 题目问的是未来的手机，与以前的手机无关。误解B：未提及，无出处。误解C：定位原文：The body makes energy from food, he argues, so it could possibly also power a phone. 译文：他认为，身体从食物中产生能量，所以它也可能为手机供电。说明事物间接供电，而C选项中“directly”意为“直接地”，故错误。

questionsList.questionNameText:
Passage Two

The man who made the first call from a wireless phone is now 94 years old. The year was 1973. Martin Cooper operated a large, heavy new communication device on a street in New York. The device was not physically connected to phone lines. But, Cooper was able to make use of it--he called a technology business competitor.

Fifty years later, the inventor says he hopes wireless phones can make life better but he also expresses some worries. “My most negative opinion is that we don't have any privacy anymore because everything about us is now recorded someplace,” Cooper said. And, he says he is concerned about how easily young people can link to harmful online materials on their mobile phones. Cooper spoke with the Associated Press from Barcelona, where he attended the Mobile World Congress (MWC), the biggest telecom industry trade show. Cooper received an award there for his lifetime of work.

He believes the technology's best days may still be ahead in areas such as education and health care. “Between the cellphone and medical technology and the internet, we are going to cure disease,” he said at the MWC.

Cooper was working for Motorola when he used the Dyna-Tac phone to make a call in April 1973. Things have changed greatly since then. But, he said, “We had no way of knowing this was the historic moment.”Cooper says there are still ways for mobile phones to change. The first one he used weighed over 1 kilogram. Today, they are small. But he thinks one day they will be more like a part of our body than something we hold.

He says perhaps the human body can even power the phones. “The human body is the charging station, right,” he asked. The body makes energy from food, he argues, so it could possibly also power a phone. Instead of holding the phone in the hand, for example, the device could be placed under the skin.

Cooper says he also hopes there can be more protection for internet users concerned about privacy and for children. Speaking about privacy concerns, he said, “It's going to get resolved, but not easily.” He also says there should be a special internet for children so they do not run into materials made for adults.
questionsList.questionTitleText: According to the last paragraph, what does Cooper suggest about protection for children?
questionsList.label: 2023年山东专升本英语真题
questionsList.firstOptionText: Providing a special internet for them.
questionsList.thirdOptionText: Placing the mobile phone under the skin.
questionsList.fourthOptionText: Allowing them to browse materials for adults.
questionsList.analysisText: 细节题。由题干中关键词“last paragraph”，定位到文章最后一段，可从原文直接寻找答案出处。正解A：可定位到原文：He also said there should be a special internet for children. 译文：他也说，应该为儿童提供特殊的网络。误解B：未提及，无出处。误解C：与题目无关。误解D：D选项译文：允许儿童浏览成年人的内容。定位到原文：so they do not run into material made for adults. 译文：这样他们就不会遇到为成年人制作的内容。所以原文暗含不允许儿童浏览成年人的内容，故错误。

questionsList.questionNameText:
Passage Three

A new study suggests the singing noises made by humpback whales (座头鲸) might be a sign of loneliness. Scientists who recorded humpback whale behavior in Australia discovered that fewer whales made the singing noises as their population grew.

“Humpback whale song is loud and travels far in the ocean.” said Rebecca Dunlop of the University of Queensland. She has long studied humpback whales and helped lead the new study. Her work has centered on humpbacks that reproduce near Australia's Great Barrier Reef. Dunlop made an unexpected finding as whale numbers sharply rose following the end of commercial whaling（捕鲸）. “It was getting more difficult to actually find singers,”she said. Dunlop added, “When there were fewer of them, there was a lot of singing--now that there are lots of them, no need to be singing so much.”

Scientists first began to hear and study the complex songs of the humpback whales in the 1970s. They used underwater microphones to do so. Only male whales sing. Eastern Australia's humpback whales came close to disappearing in the 1960s, when their number dropped to around 200. But over time the population began to regrow, climbing to about 27,000 whales by 2015. That number is near estimated pre-whaling levels.

As the density of whales increased, their singing behaviors changed. While 2 in 10 males made singing noises in 2004, 10 years later the number had dropped to 1 in 10, Dunlop said. Dunlop thought singing played a big part in bringing in mates when populations were severely reduced. “It was hard just to find other whales in the area, because there weren't many.” she added. When humpbacks live in denser populations, males looking for mates also have to deal with competing whales. Dunlop explained the singing noises might bring in other possible mates.

The research suggests the seas are still noisy with humpback whale sounds. Many humpbacks seek to bring in mates with a combination of singing and physical movements, the study notes.

The large increase in the humpback population during the study period provided valuable data about changes in the animals’ behavior, said Simon Ingram. He studies humpback whales at the University of Plymouth in Britain. Ingram said humpback whales must have been singers long before whaling reduced their numbers. He added that the new study demonstrated how necessary their complex and beautiful songs were to their survival and recovery.
questionsList.questionTitleText: According to Paragraph 1, humpback whales make singing noises probably to _____.
questionsList.label: 2023年山东专升本英语真题
questionsList.analysisText: 细节题。根据题干定位到第一段第一句话：A new study suggests the singing noises made by humpback whales might be a sign of loneliness. 题干中的“probably”同义替换句中的“might”，所以答案为“a sign of loneliness”，D选项中的“emotion”同义替换“loneliness”，故选D。

questionsList.questionNameText:
Passage Three

A new study suggests the singing noises made by humpback whales (座头鲸) might be a sign of loneliness. Scientists who recorded humpback whale behavior in Australia discovered that fewer whales made the singing noises as their population grew.

“Humpback whale song is loud and travels far in the ocean.” said Rebecca Dunlop of the University of Queensland. She has long studied humpback whales and helped lead the new study. Her work has centered on humpbacks that reproduce near Australia's Great Barrier Reef. Dunlop made an unexpected finding as whale numbers sharply rose following the end of commercial whaling（捕鲸）. “It was getting more difficult to actually find singers,”she said. Dunlop added, “When there were fewer of them, there was a lot of singing--now that there are lots of them, no need to be singing so much.”

Scientists first began to hear and study the complex songs of the humpback whales in the 1970s. They used underwater microphones to do so. Only male whales sing. Eastern Australia's humpback whales came close to disappearing in the 1960s, when their number dropped to around 200. But over time the population began to regrow, climbing to about 27,000 whales by 2015. That number is near estimated pre-whaling levels.

As the density of whales increased, their singing behaviors changed. While 2 in 10 males made singing noises in 2004, 10 years later the number had dropped to 1 in 10, Dunlop said. Dunlop thought singing played a big part in bringing in mates when populations were severely reduced. “It was hard just to find other whales in the area, because there weren't many.” she added. When humpbacks live in denser populations, males looking for mates also have to deal with competing whales. Dunlop explained the singing noises might bring in other possible mates.

The research suggests the seas are still noisy with humpback whale sounds. Many humpbacks seek to bring in mates with a combination of singing and physical movements, the study notes.

The large increase in the humpback population during the study period provided valuable data about changes in the animals’ behavior, said Simon Ingram. He studies humpback whales at the University of Plymouth in Britain. Ingram said humpback whales must have been singers long before whaling reduced their numbers. He added that the new study demonstrated how necessary their complex and beautiful songs were to their survival and recovery.
questionsList.questionTitleText: According to Paragraph 2, what can we learn about Dunlop's finding?
questionsList.label: 2023年山东专升本英语真题
questionsList.firstOptionText: All the whales are good singers.
questionsList.secondOptionText: Humpback whales are too lazy to sing.
questionsList.thirdOptionText: Commercial whaling helps protect the Great Barrier Reef.
questionsList.fourthOptionText: More humpback whales lead to reduction of singing noises.
questionsList.analysisText: 推理题。根据题干定位到第二段，A和B选项无法从原文中推理出，C选项属于文章中两个概念的胡乱结合。正解D，该段最后一句话“When there were fewer of them, there was a lot of singing--now that there are lots of them, no need to be singing so much.” 译文：座头鲸数量少的时候，它们唱得很多——现在它们数量多起来了，就没必要唱的那么多了。故选D。

questionsList.questionNameText:
Passage Three

A new study suggests the singing noises made by humpback whales (座头鲸) might be a sign of loneliness. Scientists who recorded humpback whale behavior in Australia discovered that fewer whales made the singing noises as their population grew.

“Humpback whale song is loud and travels far in the ocean.” said Rebecca Dunlop of the University of Queensland. She has long studied humpback whales and helped lead the new study. Her work has centered on humpbacks that reproduce near Australia's Great Barrier Reef. Dunlop made an unexpected finding as whale numbers sharply rose following the end of commercial whaling（捕鲸）. “It was getting more difficult to actually find singers,”she said. Dunlop added, “When there were fewer of them, there was a lot of singing--now that there are lots of them, no need to be singing so much.”

Scientists first began to hear and study the complex songs of the humpback whales in the 1970s. They used underwater microphones to do so. Only male whales sing. Eastern Australia's humpback whales came close to disappearing in the 1960s, when their number dropped to around 200. But over time the population began to regrow, climbing to about 27,000 whales by 2015. That number is near estimated pre-whaling levels.

As the density of whales increased, their singing behaviors changed. While 2 in 10 males made singing noises in 2004, 10 years later the number had dropped to 1 in 10, Dunlop said. Dunlop thought singing played a big part in bringing in mates when populations were severely reduced. “It was hard just to find other whales in the area, because there weren't many.” she added. When humpbacks live in denser populations, males looking for mates also have to deal with competing whales. Dunlop explained the singing noises might bring in other possible mates.

The research suggests the seas are still noisy with humpback whale sounds. Many humpbacks seek to bring in mates with a combination of singing and physical movements, the study notes.

The large increase in the humpback population during the study period provided valuable data about changes in the animals’ behavior, said Simon Ingram. He studies humpback whales at the University of Plymouth in Britain. Ingram said humpback whales must have been singers long before whaling reduced their numbers. He added that the new study demonstrated how necessary their complex and beautiful songs were to their survival and recovery.
questionsList.label: 2023年山东专升本英语真题
questionsList.analysisText: 细节题。根据题干，问题是“座头鲸为什么唱歌？”就是问座头鲸唱歌的原因（目的或者作用）。据此可以定位到文中第四段：Dunlop thought singing played a big part in bringing in mates when populations were severely reduced. 译文：邓洛普认为，当种群数量严重减少时，唱歌在吸引配偶方面发挥了重要作用。本句中play a big part in 意为“在……中起重要作用”，A选项为bring in mates(吸引配偶)的同义替换。故选A。

questionsList.questionNameText:
Passage Three

A new study suggests the singing noises made by humpback whales (座头鲸) might be a sign of loneliness. Scientists who recorded humpback whale behavior in Australia discovered that fewer whales made the singing noises as their population grew.

“Humpback whale song is loud and travels far in the ocean.” said Rebecca Dunlop of the University of Queensland. She has long studied humpback whales and helped lead the new study. Her work has centered on humpbacks that reproduce near Australia's Great Barrier Reef. Dunlop made an unexpected finding as whale numbers sharply rose following the end of commercial whaling（捕鲸）. “It was getting more difficult to actually find singers,”she said. Dunlop added, “When there were fewer of them, there was a lot of singing--now that there are lots of them, no need to be singing so much.”

Eastern Australia's humpback whales came close to disappearing in the 1960s, when their number dropped to around 200. As the density of whales increased, their singing behaviors changed. While 2 in 10 males made singing noises in 2004, 10 years later the number had dropped to 1 in 10, Dunlop said. Dunlop thought singing played a big part in bringing in mates when populations were severely reduced. “It was hard just to find other whales in the area, because there weren't many.” she added. When humpbacks live in denser populations, males looking for mates also have to deal with competing whales. Dunlop explained the singing noises might bring in other possible mates.

The research suggests the seas are still noisy with humpback whale sounds. Many humpbacks seek to bring in mates with a combination of singing and physical movements, the study notes.

The large increase in the humpback population during the study period provided valuable data about changes in the animals’ behavior, said Simon Ingram. He studies humpback whales at the University of Plymouth in Britain. Ingram said humpback whales must have been singers long before whaling reduced their numbers. He added that the new study demonstrated how necessary their complex and beautiful songs were to their survival and recovery.
questionsList.label: 2023年山东专升本英语真题
questionsList.analysisText: 细节题。根据第二段“she has long studied humpback whales and helped lead the new study. Her work has centered on humpbacks that reproduce near Australia's Great Barrier Reef.” 译文：她长期以来一直在研究座头鲸，并帮助领导了这项新研究。她的工作集中在澳大利亚大堡礁附近繁殖的座头鲸。可知她是研究海洋生物的。故选A。

questionsList.questionNameText:
Passage Three

A new study suggests the singing noises made by humpback whales (座头鲸) might be a sign of loneliness. Scientists who recorded humpback whale behavior in Australia discovered that fewer whales made the singing noises as their population grew.

“Humpback whale song is loud and travels far in the ocean.” said Rebecca Dunlop of the University of Queensland. She has long studied humpback whales and helped lead the new study. Her work has centered on humpbacks that reproduce near Australia's Great Barrier Reef. Dunlop made an unexpected finding as whale numbers sharply rose following the end of commercial whaling（捕鲸）. “It was getting more difficult to actually find singers,”she said. Dunlop added, “When there were fewer of them, there was a lot of singing--now that there are lots of them, no need to be singing so much.”

Scientists first began to hear and study the complex songs of the humpback whales in the 1970s. They used underwater microphones to do so. Only male whales sing. Eastern Australia's humpback whales came close to disappearing in the 1960s, when their number dropped to around 200. But over time the population began to regrow, climbing to about 27,000 whales by 2015. That number is near estimated pre-whaling levels.

As the density of whales increased, their singing behaviors changed. While 2 in 10 males made singing noises in 2004, 10 years later the number had dropped to 1 in 10, Dunlop said. Dunlop thought singing played a big part in bringing in mates when populations were severely reduced. “It was hard just to find other whales in the area, because there weren't many.” she added. When humpbacks live in denser populations, males looking for mates also have to deal with competing whales. Dunlop explained the singing noises might bring in other possible mates.

The research suggests the seas are still noisy with humpback whale sounds. Many humpbacks seek to bring in mates with a combination of singing and physical movements, the study notes.

The large increase in the humpback population during the study period provided valuable data about changes in the animals’ behavior, said Simon Ingram. He studies humpback whales at the University of Plymouth in Britain. Ingram said humpback whales must have been singers long before whaling reduced their numbers. He added that the new study demonstrated how necessary their complex and beautiful songs were to their survival and recovery.
questionsList.label: 2023年山东专升本英语真题
questionsList.firstOptionText: stop singing after the whaling ends in Plymouth
questionsList.secondOptionText: rely on their songs for their survival and recovery
questionsList.thirdOptionText: change their singing behaviors constantly in Britain
questionsList.fourthOptionText: make more singing noises with the help of scientists
questionsList.analysisText: 细节题。根据题干定位到最后一段 He added that the new study demonstrated how necessary their complex and beautiful songs were to their survival and recovery. 译文：但他补充说，这项新研究表明，它们复杂而美丽的歌声对它们的生存和恢复是多么必要。可知，座头鲸依赖它们的歌声来生存和恢复。故选B。

questionsList.questionNameText:
The benefits of having good leadership in the workplace have long been documented. A good leader can inspire employees to perform at their best, which can improve the efficiency of an organization.   26  

Learn from the best. Think about leaders who you have worked under in the past.   27   You should always ensure that you have all viewpoints before you make your decision. Being a good leader is about commitment to being a better you. Consider taking an education course, which will be of great help for you.

  28   Good leaders must communicate effectively about their intentions, goals, and expectations. You can organize meetings on a regular basis, receive feedback from your employees, and never speak in anger to them.

  29   A good leader must be able to inspire the employees to approach tasks in the best possible way. To do this, you must become a hard working person that the employees can follow.

Honor achievers. It is important that the employees who go above and beyond their basic job description be rewarded for doing a good job.   30   This is a recognition that it takes all the people below you to make the company succeed.

A good leader not only accepts that a business is doing well, but also pushes the employees to be better than they are in order to achieve even more.
questionsList.label: 2023年山东专升本英语真题
questionsList.thirdOptionText: Improve the efficiency of your business.
questionsList.fourthOptionText: Here are some ways to improve your leadership skills.
questionsList.analysisText: 根据文章结构，第一段讲的是领导力的好处，下文讲的是如何提高自己的领导力。因此空格处的句子要“承上启下”，要引出下文的具体建议，故选D。
questionsList.fifthOptionText: You should try to acknowledge a person who works hard.
questionsList.sixthOptionText: There are as many creative processes as there are creative leaders.
questionsList.seventhOptionText: Their personal experience and knowledge can help you become a great leader.

questionsList.questionNameText:
The benefits of having good leadership in the workplace have long been documented. A good leader can inspire employees to perform at their best, which can improve the efficiency of an organization.   26  

Learn from the best. Think about leaders who you have worked under in the past.   27   You should always ensure that you have all viewpoints before you make your decision. Being a good leader is about commitment to being a better you. Consider taking an education course, which will be of great help for you.

  28   Good leaders must communicate effectively about their intentions, goals, and expectations. You can organize meetings on a regular basis, receive feedback from your employees, and never speak in anger to them.

  29   A good leader must be able to inspire the employees to approach tasks in the best possible way. To do this, you must become a hard working person that the employees can follow.

Honor achievers. It is important that the employees who go above and beyond their basic job description be rewarded for doing a good job.   30   This is a recognition that it takes all the people below you to make the company succeed.

A good leader not only accepts that a business is doing well, but also pushes the employees to be better than they are in order to achieve even more.
questionsList.label: 2023年山东专升本英语真题
questionsList.thirdOptionText: Improve the efficiency of your business.
questionsList.fourthOptionText: Here are some ways to improve your leadership skills.
questionsList.analysisText: 根据第二句的主题句“Learn from the best”(向最优秀的人学习)，可知本段主要表明借助别人的经验来完善自己，故选G。意为“他们的个人经验和知识可以帮助你成为一名好的领导者。”
questionsList.fifthOptionText: You should try to acknowledge a person who works hard.
questionsList.sixthOptionText: There are as many creative processes as there are creative leaders.
questionsList.seventhOptionText: Their personal experience and knowledge can help you become a great leader.

questionsList.questionNameText:
The benefits of having good leadership in the workplace have long been documented. A good leader can inspire employees to perform at their best, which can improve the efficiency of an organization.   26  

Learn from the best. Think about leaders who you have worked under in the past.   27   You should always ensure that you have all viewpoints before you make your decision. Being a good leader is about commitment to being a better you. Consider taking an education course, which will be of great help for you.

  28   Good leaders must communicate effectively about their intentions, goals, and expectations. You can organize meetings on a regular basis, receive feedback from your employees, and never speak in anger to them.

  29   A good leader must be able to inspire the employees to approach tasks in the best possible way. To do this, you must become a hard working person that the employees can follow.

Honor achievers. It is important that the employees who go above and beyond their basic job description be rewarded for doing a good job.   30   This is a recognition that it takes all the people below you to make the company succeed.

A good leader not only accepts that a business is doing well, but also pushes the employees to be better than they are in order to achieve even more.
questionsList.label: 2023年山东专升本英语真题
questionsList.thirdOptionText: Improve the efficiency of your business.
questionsList.fourthOptionText: Here are some ways to improve your leadership skills.
questionsList.analysisText: 根据文章结构，空格在段首句，内容应该是具体的建议，答案应为祈使句。根据第二句话“Good leaders must communicate effectively...”中的关键词 “communicate” 确定答案为B。B选项意为“做一个好的沟通者”。
questionsList.fifthOptionText: You should try to acknowledge a person who works hard.
questionsList.sixthOptionText: There are as many creative processes as there are creative leaders.
questionsList.seventhOptionText: Their personal experience and knowledge can help you become a great leader.

questionsList.questionNameText:
The benefits of having good leadership in the workplace have long been documented. A good leader can inspire employees to perform at their best, which can improve the efficiency of an organization.   26  

Learn from the best. Think about leaders who you have worked under in the past.   27   You should always ensure that you have all viewpoints before you make your decision. Being a good leader is about commitment to being a better you. Consider taking an education course, which will be of great help for you.

  28   Good leaders must communicate effectively about their intentions, goals, and expectations. You can organize meetings on a regular basis, receive feedback from your employees, and never speak in anger to them.

  29   A good leader must be able to inspire the employees to approach tasks in the best possible way. To do this, you must become a hard working person that the employees can follow.

Honor achievers. It is important that the employees who go above and beyond their basic job description be rewarded for doing a good job.   30   This is a recognition that it takes all the people below you to make the company succeed.

A good leader not only accepts that a business is doing well, but also pushes the employees to be better than they are in order to achieve even more.
questionsList.label: 2023年山东专升本英语真题
questionsList.thirdOptionText: Improve the efficiency of your business.
questionsList.fourthOptionText: Here are some ways to improve your leadership skills.
questionsList.analysisText: 根据文章结构，空格在段首句，内容应该是具体的建议，答案必须为祈使句。结合第三句 “you must become a hard working person that the employees can follow” (你必须成为一个努力工作的人，让员工能够追随)，通过follow (跟随，追随) 可知要给员工树立榜样，故选A。意为“以身作则”。
questionsList.fifthOptionText: You should try to acknowledge a person who works hard.
questionsList.sixthOptionText: There are as many creative processes as there are creative leaders.
questionsList.seventhOptionText: Their personal experience and knowledge can help you become a great leader.

questionsList.questionNameText:
The benefits of having good leadership in the workplace have long been documented. A good leader can inspire employees to perform at their best, which can improve the efficiency of an organization.   26  

Learn from the best. Think about leaders who you have worked under in the past.   27   You should always ensure that you have all viewpoints before you make your decision. Being a good leader is about commitment to being a better you. Consider taking an education course, which will be of great help for you.

  28   Good leaders must communicate effectively about their intentions, goals, and expectations. You can organize meetings on a regular basis, receive feedback from your employees, and never speak in anger to them.

  29   A good leader must be able to inspire the employees to approach tasks in the best possible way. To do this, you must become a hard working person that the employees can follow.

Honor achievers. It is important that the employees who go above and beyond their basic job description be rewarded for doing a good job.   30   This is a recognition that it takes all the people below you to make the company succeed.

A good leader not only accepts that a business is doing well, but also pushes the employees to be better than they are in order to achieve even more.
questionsList.label: 2023年山东专升本英语真题
questionsList.thirdOptionText: Improve the efficiency of your business.
questionsList.fourthOptionText: Here are some ways to improve your leadership skills.
questionsList.analysisText: 根据文章结构，空白处的句子要承上启下。结合段首句“Honor achievers.”意为“表扬取得成绩的人”，又根据空格前句子中的关键词“reward (奖励) ” 和空格后句子的关键词 “recognition（表彰，认可）” ，说明本段和赞赏员工的努力有关。选项E中的acknowledge (认可；感谢) 和honor，reward，recognition为同义词。故选E。意为“你应该设法感谢工作努力的人”。
questionsList.fifthOptionText: You should try to acknowledge a person who works hard.
questionsList.sixthOptionText: There are as many creative processes as there are creative leaders.
questionsList.seventhOptionText: Their personal experience and knowledge can help you become a great leader.

questionsList.questionNameText:
Part III Translation (20 points)

Section A (10 points)

Directions: In this section, you should translate a passage from English into Chinese. You should write your answer on the ANSWER SHEET.


Your relationship with yourself will last your whole lifetime, so you should regard yourself as your best friend. Getting on well with yourself should be a top priority to you if you want to be a happy person. You can practice self-talk, build confidence, and focus on self-development. A healthy self-relationship can help you create a positive self-image which is vital for you to become the best version of yourself.
questionsList.label: 2023年山东专升本英语真题
questionsList.correctText: 你和自己的关系会持续一生，所以你应该把自己当成最好的朋友。如果你想成为一个快乐的人，与自己相处融洽应该是你的首要任务。你可以练习自言自语，建立自信，专注于自我发展。一个健康的自我关系可以帮助你建立一个积极的自我形象，这对你成为最好的自己至关重要。

questionsList.questionNameText:
Section B (10 points)

Directions: In this section, you should translate a passage from Chinese into English. You should write your answer on the ANSWER SHEET.


黄河是中华民族的母亲河，保护黄河生态环境 (ecological environment) 日益重要。我们要行动起来，精心呵护黄河，加强生态环境保护，促进人与自然和谐发展，创造更加美好的生活。
questionsList.label: 2023年山东专升本英语真题
questionsList.correctText: The Yellow River is the mother river of the Chinese nation. Protecting the ecological environment of the Yellow River is becoming increasingly important. We should take actions to take good care of the River, strengthen the ecological environment, promote the harmonious development of man and nature, and create a more wonderful life.

questionsList.questionNameText:
Part IV Writing (20 points)

Directions: In this section, write an essay on How to Improve Digital Literacy Skills for English Learning based on the following information:


Digital literacy (数字素养) skills are important for language learners to find, evaluate, and communicate information by using technology. As a college student, how should you improve your digital literacy skills for English learning?

Your essay should include:

(1) the use of digital technology for English learning;

(2) the ways of improving digital literacy skills for English learning.

You should write at least 100 words in English. Please write your essay on the ANSWER SHEET.
questionsList.label: 2023年山东专升本英语真题
questionsList.correctText:
【参考范文】

How to Improve Digital Literacy Skills for English Learning

In the digital era, digital literacy is crucial for college students to learn English. The digital technology plays an important role in my life. When I learn English, I often use some digital devices and platforms. I enlarge my vocabulary by use of apps and read English stories from different websites.

There are many ways to improve digital literacy skills for English learning. I will take more online courses about different digital technologies. To keep up with technological advancements, I will try experimenting with new digital tools. In addition, I will turn to my teachers for help to learn what digital resources for English learning are available and how to use them.

By improving my digital literacy skills, I will become an effective and independent learner of English.
